body.p: The Changes view displays all the files that have been changed in the workspace. It contains two tabs (Made by you and History).

The Made by you tab displays all the changes you have made and provides two main options for your changes:
Commit - Allows you to commit your changes to the project.
New Review Task - Allows you to create a review task that contains all your current changes so that others can review them before integration.

In the list of files, you can click on a file to see a comparison (diff) of the changes. The version on the left shows the current workspace version while the version on the right shows the current repository version.

A contextual menu can be invoked by clicking the 3 vertical dots (ellipsis) next to a particular file when hovering over it and the following actions are available:
Open file - Opens the latest editable workspace version of the file in the editor.
Discard changes - Discards any changes you have made to the file.
Deselect all files - Deselects all files you have selected.
Discard changes from all files - Discards all changes you have made.

The History tab shows all repository commits up to the latest one currently in your workspace. You can hover over a commit to see more details, such as the committer's name, date, and the commit message. If you click on a commit, the committed files are displayed at the bottom of the pane.

section.title: Commit
section.p: When you are ready to save your changes to the project, use the Commit... button. You will be prompted to provide a commit message and then commit the changes.

p.note: The commit action will also push your selected changes to the corresponding branch in the project repository.

section.p: By default, all the files are included in the commit. However, each file in the Changes view has a checkbox that allows you to include or exclude it from the commit. The files that are not selected will remain in your workspace. If you exclude some of the files, the New Review Task button is disabled because creating a review task from a selection of files is not currently supported. To create a review task, all changed files must be included.

section.title: Create New Review Task Based on Your Workspace Changes
section.p: After making changes in your personal workspace, you can create a new review task that contains your changes. You can then share the task with others so that they review your changes before you integrate them back into the project.

To create a review task based on your changes, click the New Review Task button at the bottom of the Changes view. In the resulting page, you can give the review task a title, set a Due date, and select a Context publication from the list of defined publications for the project. The changed files that are automatically attached to the review task are listed in the Files to review box. Click Create when you are finished configuring the new review task. You can then share the task with Reviewers.
